reference.title: output.txt contract (required sections)
reference.shortdesc: The analyzer must write nine sections to output.txt in order using exact labels.

ul.li: Available countries => COUNTRY1, COUNTRY2, ... (uppercase, no duplicates)
Available continents => CONTINENT1, CONTINENT2, ... (uppercase, no duplicates)

li.codeph: At international rank => <WORLD_RANK> the university name is => <UNIVERSITY>
At national rank => <NATIONAL_RANK> the university name is => <UNIVERSITY>

ul.li: The relative score to the top university in CONTINENT is => (<AVG_SCORE> / <TOP_CONTINENT_SCORE>) x 100% = <RELATIVE_SCORE>% (rounded to 2 decimals)
The universities that contain the capital name => then numbered list lines

section.title: Example (Japan)
section.codeblock: Total number of universities => 100 Available countries => JAPAN, ... Available continents => NORTH AMERICA, ... At international rank => 13 the university name is => UNIVERSITY OF TOKYO At national rank => 1 the university name is => KYOTO UNIVERSITY The average score => 85.35% The relative score to the top university in ASIA is => (85.35 / 89.80) x 100% = 95.04% The capital is => TOKYO The universities that contain the capital name => #1 UNIVERSITY OF TOKYO
